questions.question_text: When defining SLAs for the service catalog, at what level is the SLA typically defined?

discussion.content: SLA Definition has an option to create SLA for sc_task , sc_request, sc_req_item. So A , B,D is the answer
In Washington, the SLA can be defined a the Request, Requested Item, or the Catalog Task.

comments.content:
Correct, this is what is says in the ebook. A & C is correct.

servicenow.read.inkling.com
IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation On Demand
Module 4.4 Service Catalog and Request Management
Page: Service Level Agreements

discussion.content: A is correct. Define Service Level Agreements for catalog items on the sc_req_item table.

Selected Answer: A
SLA has to be on a specific item and not on a catalog

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

Selected Answer: A
p195
SLA for Catalog items

Selected Answer: A
Correct is A
Requested item [sc_req_item] table for SLA

questions.question_text:
Your customer wants to limit the users who are able to see internal Network requests, to members of the Network department.

Which roles would enable you to make these required changes? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
servicenow.read.inkling.com
IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation On Demand
Module 4.3 Service Catalog and Request Management
Page: User Criteria

Answer is B & C

Selected Answer: BC
From the book:
The catalog_admin role contains the user_criteria_admin role. This allows users with catalog_admin to manage user criteria.

Selected Answer: BC
BC
p126

Selected Answer: BC
correct

Selected Answer: A
Correct is A

Multi-row variable set
Use a multi-row variable set (MRVS) to capture variable data in a grid layout while submitting a catalog item request for a group of entities. 

https://docs.servicenow.com/ja-JP/bundle/utah-servicenow-platform/page/product/service-catalog-management/concept/c_ServiceCatalogVariableSets.html

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.
ITSM-Tokyo ebook Page (147)
Correct answer is A - Multi-Row Variable Set Creates a variable set with multiple rows that captures variable data in a grid layout

questions.question_text: What should you use to capture data in a grid layout on a catalog item?
From a data model perspective, which table is the base class for the configuration management database?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
servicenow.read.inkling.com
IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation On Demand
Module 2.1 CMDB & CSDM
Page: Data Structures

Answer is D

Selected Answer: D
ITSM (Rome) page 34 - 
Over 500 classes extend from Base Configuration Item [cmdb], the base class for CMDB.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct. cmdb_ci is a child table of cmdb

Selected Answer: D
Base class is Base Configuration Item [cmdb] table

Selected Answer: D
correct is D.
Base class is Base Configuration Item [cmdb] table
